newsitem.title: UK: Maverick British MP to stand against Conservatives.
newsitem.headline: Maverick British MP to stand against Conservatives.

text.p: A parliamentarian who lost his right to defend his Conservative seat at the next election after calling Prime Minister John Major "a ventriloquist's dummy" has said he wants to stand against the ruling party.

Sir George Gardiner, a leading Eurosceptic who fears Brussels is encroaching on British sovereignty, was on Thursday deselected as a Conservative candidate by local party officials in the southern English constituency of Reigate.
He said in a newspaper article to be published on Sunday that he intends to stand as a "genuine Conservative" in the election Major must hold by next May.

Writing in the Mail on Sunday, Gardiner maintained his criticism of Major, saying the prime minister was "so washed up we could see he was very near to throwing in the towel" at a meeting with rank-and-file Conservative members of parliament.
Gardiner has been a persistent critic of Major over Europe, the issue that has caused so much internecine strife in the ruling party.
The Conservatives trail the opposition Labour in opinion polls in the runup to the election.
